-C.value: try { Use-Icinga -Minimal; } catch { Write-Output 'The Icinga PowerShell Framework is either not installed on the system or not configured properly. Please check https://icinga.com/docs/windows for further details'; Write-Output 'Error:' $$($$_.Exception.Message)Components:`r`n$$( Get-Module -ListAvailable 'icinga-powershell-*' )`r`n'Module-Path:'`r`n$$($$Env:PSModulePath); exit 3; }; Exit-IcingaExecutePlugin -Command '$ifw_api_command$'

-ThresholdInterval.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckClusterHealth_String_ThresholdInterval$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;
var str = macro("$IcingaCheckClusterSharedVolume_String_ThresholdInterval$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;
var str = macro("$IcingaCheckClusterNetwork_String_ThresholdInterval$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

7.description: Allows to specify for which node state the check will throw a warning
7.caption: WarningState

5.description: Used to specify an array of nodes to include, allows '*' wildcard
5.caption: Include

21.description:
Used to specify a Critical threshold for the SharedVolume, either in % or as byte unit
Example: 10% or 10GB
21.caption: SpaceCritical

18.description:
Used to Filter out which Cluster Shared Volumes you want to check, provided you have
several SharedVolumes on your system. Example ('Cluster disk 2')
18.caption: IncludeVolumes

12.description: Change the value your defined threshold checks against from the current value to a collected time threshold of the Icinga for Windows daemon, as described here: https://icinga.com/docs/icinga-for-windows/latest/doc/service/10-Register-Service-Checks/ An example for this argument would be 1m or 15m which will use the average of 1m or 15m for monitoring.
12.caption: ThresholdInterval

10.description: Disables the performance data output of this plugin
10.caption: NoPerfData

2.description: Defines with which Execution Policy the PowerShell is started
2.caption: PowerShell Execution Policy

22.description: Disables the performance data output of this plugin
22.caption: NoPerfData

8.description: Allows to specify for which node state the check will throw a critical
8.caption: CriticalState

17.description: Change the value your defined threshold checks against from the current value to a collected time threshold of the Icinga for Windows daemon, as described here: https://icinga.com/docs/icinga-for-windows/latest/doc/service/10-Register-Service-Checks/ An example for this argument would be 1m or 15m which will use the average of 1m or 15m for monitoring.
17.caption: ThresholdInterval

11.description:
Changes the behavior of the plugin output which check states are printed:
0 (default): Only service checks/packages with state not OK will be printed
1: Only services with not OK will be printed including OK checks of affected check packages including Package config
2: Everything will be printed regardless of the check state
3: Identical to Verbose 2, but prints in addition the check package configuration e.g (All must be [OK])
11.caption: Verbosity

9.description: Removes the Cluster Resources package from the check output if set to true
9.caption: SkipClusterRessource

20.description:
Used to specify a Warning threshold for the SharedVolume, either in % or as byte unit
Example: 10% or 10GB
20.caption: SpaceWarning

23.description:
Changes the behavior of the plugin output which check states are printed:
0 (default): Only service checks/packages with state not OK will be printed
1: Only services with not OK will be printed including OK checks of affected check packages including Package config
2: Everything will be printed regardless of the check state
3: Identical to Verbose 2, but prints in addition the check package configuration e.g (All must be [OK])
23.caption: Verbosity

6.description: Used to specify an array of nodes to exclude, allows '*' wildcard
6.caption: Exclude

4.description: Change the value your defined threshold checks against from the current value to a collected time threshold of the Icinga for Windows daemon, as described here: https://icinga.com/docs/icinga-for-windows/latest/doc/service/10-Register-Service-Checks/ An example for this argument would be 1m or 15m which will use the average of 1m or 15m for monitoring.
4.caption: ThresholdInterval

19.description:
Used to Filter out which Cluster Shared Volumes you don't want to check, provided you have
several SharedVolumes on your system. Example ('Cluster disk 2').
19.caption: ExcludeVolumes
